013package org.apache.juneau.bean.openapi3;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConverterUtils.*;
018
019import java.util.*;
020
021import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
022import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
023
024/**
025 * Provides schema and examples for the media type identified by its key.
026 *
027 * <p>
028 * Each Media Type Object provides schema and examples for the media type identified by its key (e.g., <js>"application/json"</js>).
029 * Media types are used in request bodies and response content to describe the structure and format of the data being sent or received.
030 *
031 * <h5 class='section'>OpenAPI Specification:</h5>
032 * <p>
033 * The Media Type Object is composed of the following fields:
034 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
035 *    <li><c>schema</c> ({@link SchemaInfo}) - The schema defining the content
036 *    <li><c>example</c> (any) - Example of the media type (mutually exclusive with <c>examples</c>)
037 *    <li><c>examples</c> (map of {@link Example}) - Examples of the media type (mutually exclusive with <c>example</c>)
038 *    <li><c>encoding</c> (map of {@link Encoding}) - A map between a property name and its encoding information
039 * </ul>
040 *
041 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
042 * <p class='bjava'>
043 *    <jc>// Create a MediaType for JSON content</jc>
044 *    MediaType <jv>mediaType</jv> = <jk>new</jk> MediaType()
045 *       .setSchema(
046 *          <jk>new</jk> SchemaInfo()
047 *             .setType(<js>"object"</js>)
048 *             .setProperties(
049 *                JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(
050 *                   <js>"id"</js>, <jk>new</jk> SchemaInfo().setType(<js>"integer"</js>),
051 *                   <js>"name"</js>, <jk>new</jk> SchemaInfo().setType(<js>"string"</js>)
052 *                )
053 *             )
054 *       )
055 *       .setExample(
056 *          JsonMap.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"id"</js>, 123, <js>"name"</js>, <js>"Fluffy"</js>)
057 *       );
058 * </p>
059 *
060 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
061 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.0#media-type-object">OpenAPI Specification &gt; Media Type Object</a>
062 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://swagger.io/docs/specification/media-types/">OpenAPI Media Types</a>
063 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanOpenApi3">juneau-bean-openapi-v3</a>
064 * </ul>
065 */
066public class MediaType extends OpenApiElement{
067   private SchemaInfo schema;
068   private Object example;
069   private Map<String,Example> examples;
070   private Map<String,Encoding> encoding;
071
072   /**
073    * Default constructor.
074    */
075   public MediaType() { }
076
077   /**
078    * Copy constructor.
079    *
080    * @param copyFrom The object to copy.
081    */
082   public MediaType(MediaType copyFrom) {
083      super(copyFrom);
084
085      this.schema = copyFrom.schema;
086      this.example = copyFrom.example;
087      this.examples = copyOf(copyFrom.examples, Example::copy);
088      this.encoding = copyOf(copyFrom.encoding, Encoding::copy);
089   }
090
091   /**
092    * Make a deep copy of this object.
093    *
094    * @return A deep copy of this object.
095    */
096   public MediaType copy() {
097      return new MediaType(this);
098   }
099
100   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
101   protected MediaType strict() {
102      super.strict();
103      return this;
104   }
105
106   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
107   public MediaType strict(Object value) {
108      super.strict(value);
109      return this;
110   }
111
112   /**
113    * Bean property getter:  <property>schema</property>.
114    *
115    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
116    */
117   public SchemaInfo getSchema() {
118      return schema;
119   }
120
121   /**
122    * Bean property setter:  <property>schema</property>.
123    *
124    * @param value
125    *    The new value for this property.
126    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
127    * @return This object
128    */
129   public MediaType setSchema(SchemaInfo value) {
130      schema = value;
131      return this;
132   }
133
134   /**
135    * Bean property getter:  <property>x-example</property>.
136    *
137    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
138    */
139   @Beanp("x-example")
140   public Object getExample() {
141      return example;
142   }
143
144   /**
145    * Bean property setter:  <property>examples</property>.
146    *
147    * @param value
148    *    The new value for this property.
149    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
150    * @return This object
151    */
152   @Beanp("x-example")
153   public MediaType setExample(Object value) {
154      example = value;
155      return this;
156   }
157
158   /**
159    * Bean property getter:  <property>variables</property>.
160    *
161    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
162    */
163   public Map<String, Encoding> getEncoding() {
164      return encoding;
165   }
166
167   /**
168    * Bean property setter:  <property>variables</property>.
169    *
170    * @param value
171    *    The new value for this property.
172    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
173    * @return This object
174    */
175   public MediaType setEncoding(Map<String, Encoding> value) {
176      encoding = copyOf(value);
177      return this;
178   }
179
180   /**
181    * Adds one or more values to the <property>variables</property> property.
182    *
183    * @param key The mapping key.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
184    * @param value 
185    *    The values to add to this property.
186    *    <br>Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
187    * @return This object
188    */
189   public MediaType addEncoding(String key, Encoding value) {
190      assertArgNotNull("key", key);
191      assertArgNotNull("value", value);
192      encoding = mapBuilder(encoding).sparse().add(key, value).build();
193      return this;
194   }
195
196   /**
197    * Bean property getter:  <property>examples</property>.
198    *
199    * <p>
200    * The list of possible responses as they are returned from executing this operation.
201    *
202    * @return The property value, or <jk>null</jk> if it is not set.
203    */
204   public Map<String,Example> getExamples() {
205      return examples;
206   }
207
208   /**
209    * Bean property setter:  <property>headers</property>.
210    *
211    * <p>
212    * A list of examples that are sent with the response.
213    *
214    * @param value
215    *    The new value for this property.
216    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> to unset the property.
217    * @return This object
218    */
219   public MediaType setExamples(Map<String,Example> value) {
220      examples = copyOf(value);
221      return this;
222   }
223
224   /**
225    * Adds a single value to the <property>examples</property> property.
226    *
227    * @param name The example name.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
228    * @param example The example.  Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
229    * @return This object
230    */
231   public MediaType addExample(String name, Example example) {
232      assertArgNotNull("name", name);
233      assertArgNotNull("example", example);
234      examples = mapBuilder(examples).add(name, example).build();
235      return this;
236   }
237
238   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
239   public <T> T get(String property, Class<T> type) {
240      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
241      return switch (property) {
242         case "encoding" -> toType(getEncoding(), type);
243         case "examples" -> toType(getExamples(), type);
244         case "schema" -> toType(getSchema(), type);
245         case "x-example" -> toType(getExample(), type);
246         default -> super.get(property, type);
247      };
248   }
249
250   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
251   public MediaType set(String property, Object value) {
252      assertArgNotNull("property", property);
253      return switch (property) {
254         case "encoding" -> setEncoding(mapBuilder(String.class,Encoding.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
255         case "examples" -> setExamples(mapBuilder(String.class,Example.class).sparse().addAny(value).build());
256         case "schema" -> setSchema(toType(value, SchemaInfo.class));
257         case "x-example" -> setExample(value);
258         default -> {
259            super.set(property, value);
260            yield this;
261         }
262      };
263   }
264
265   @Override /* Overridden from OpenApiElement */
266   public Set<String> keySet() {
267      var s = setBuilder(String.class)
268         .addIf(schema != null, "schema")
269         .addIf(example != null, "x-example")
270         .addIf(encoding != null, "encoding")
271         .addIf(examples != null, "examples")
272         .build();
273      return new MultiSet<>(s, super.keySet());
274   }
275}
